distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for emacs fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2022-45939: Fixed shell command injection via source code files when using ctags (bsc#1205822).
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: GNU Emacs through 28.2 allows attackers to execute commands via shell metacharacters in the name of a source-code file, because lib-src/etags.c uses the system C library function in its implementation of the ctags program. For example, a victim may use the "ctags *" command (suggested in the ctags documentation) in a situation where the current working directory has contents that depend on untrusted input.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
